result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Kline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during period of supervision.
Pay supervision fees.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

No contact with victim or victim's family members
No contact with children under the age of 18 years without prior approval of agent
Not to engage in any occupation or activity involved with children

Register with Sex offender Registry program and cooperate with supervision
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants
Assessment to determine if sex offender treatment is appropriate
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Brandon L Kline by video from Stanley Correctional with attorneys Matthew Pinix and Michael G. Levine.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Attorney Pinix as to report from Dr. Kaplan.  Statement by Attorney Sisley.  The State requests the Court deny the motion.  Response by Attorney Pinix.  Discussions as to the Setencing after Revocation Hearing transcripts.  Counsel requests the Court recognize mitigating factors of the defendant's autism spectrum disorder and to modify the sentence due to that disorder.  Court finds that in terms of the defense' first arguments that the Court did make reference to previous sentencing hearing and included that in the sentencing after revocation hearing.  Denies defense request.  Court denies 2nd motion.  Attorney Pinix to prepare order and email to Attorney Sisley first and then efile with the Court.

Defendant Brandon L Kline in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Counsel is requesting a pre-sentence investigation be done. State gives recommendation upon a plea to Count 1:   Imposed/Stayed sentence; 7 years probation; conditions of probation to be determined; 1 year condition time. Count 2: Dismiss and read-in. Court examines defendant, accepts no contest plea and finds defendant guilty. Court orders PSI to be conducted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
